verses.roman:
tvat-sākṣāt-karaṇāhlāda-
viśuddhābdhi-sthitasya me
sukhāni goṣpadāyante
brāhmāṇy api jagad-guro

synonyms: tvat—Your; sākṣāt—meeting; karaṇa—such action; āhlāda—pleasure; vi-śuddha—spiritually purified; abdhi—ocean; sthitasya—being situated; me—by me; sukhāni—happiness; goṣpadāyante—a small hole created by the hoof of a calf; brāhmāṇi—the pleasure derived from impersonal Brahman understanding; api—also; jagat-guro—O master of the universe.
translation: " 'My dear Lord, O master of the universe, since I have directly seen You, my transcendental bliss has taken the shape of a great ocean. Being situated in that ocean, I now realize all other so-called happiness to be like the water contained in the hoofprint of a calf.'

purport.content: This is a verse from the Hari-bhakti-sudhodaya (14.36).
